contents.name: [BPD-01] Business Partner ABEs Level 1
contents.publish:qualifiedname: SID Models::Business Partner Domain::[BPD-01] Business Partner ABEs Level 1

publish:property.name: Description
publish:property.publish:value: The diagram below lists the Business Partner Domain's ABEs....

ownedComment.body:
The diagram below lists the Business Partner Domain's ABEs.
[] Supplier Roles ABE • Manages Supplier roles and related information. [] Partner Roles ABE • Manages Partner roles and related information. [] Business Partner Product Order ABE • The Business Partner Product Order ABE contains all entities required to specify a communication used to procure, update or remove one or many Products in the context of a ProductOffering for the Service Provider. [] Party Account ABE • Party Account ABE represents entities that are similar to those in the Customer ABE, such as PartyAccount and Party Account Contact. [] Party Product Specification and Offering ABE • The Party Product Specification and Offering ABE represents the involvement parties playing roles have with ProductSpecifications and Product Offerings, such as ordered from and billed by. [] Party Revenue & Settlement ABE • Party Revenue & Settlement ABE is composed of revenue sharing and settlements. [] Party Problem ABE (preliminary) • Focuses on technical assistance and problem handling reported to and by other parties. [] Applied Party Billing Rate ABE (preliminary) • [] Party Bill Collection ABE (preliminary) • The Party Bill Collection ABE handles credit violations, actions for overdue debts (Dunning), and all what is related to PartyPayment. [] Party Bill ABE (preliminary) • [] Party Service Level Agreement ABE (preliminary) • Party Service Level Agreement ABE represents an SLA with one or more other parties. See the Agreement ABE for additional details. [] Party Interaction ABE (preliminary) • Party Interaction ABE represents communications with parties, and the translation of requests and inquiries into appropriate "events" such as the creation of an order, the creation of a bill inquiry, or the creation of a problem. [] Party Statistic ABE (not fully developed) • Party Statistic ABE represents the analysis of party usage patterns, profitability statistics. [] Party Strategy & Plan ABE (not fully developed) • The strategies and the planning of the business relation with the other parties with input from other ABEs, such as MarketSales, Party Performance and Competitor Analysis.

publish:partInfo.name: Party Product Specification and Offering ABE

ownedComment.body:
The Business Partner domain represents roles, information and activities carried out by parties (e.g. individuals / organizations) playing roles that are involved in the strategic planning, definition, development, operational aspects and all types of contact with Business Partners (e.g. Suppliers, Partners, etc.) with which an enterprise collaborates in order to operate their business. Activities include management of Business Partner: strategies, capabilities, value propositions, relationships, profiles, data, privacy, security, interactions, communications, tenders, agreements, orders, requisitions, supplies, accounts, balances, inventories, reconciliations, service level agreements (SLAs), training, problems, cases, invoices, payments, revenues, disputes, collections, loyalty, performance, usage statistics, analytics and support of Business Partners as they supply, acquire, use, support, purchase, pay for and are supported for goods and services (products) that they provide and / or obtain from an enterprise.
A Business Partner is a commercial party with which the Enterprise (i.e. Service Provider) has some form of cooperative alliance. This relationship may range from a formal contractual, exclusive bond in which both parties commit to not ally with third parties, to a loose arrangement of associated parties. Many of the Business Partner Domain information and activities are business partner role-specific specializations of generalized concepts defined within the Foundation Domain.
ownedComment.name: <Unnamed Comment>
